The Grey card I am buying comes with a black and white card. Where/when/why would I use the black and white cards? I have a 100% understanding of the Grey card. Where in my workflow would I use the black and white cards?
This is a quote from Wayne Gretzky about hockey, I think it is applicable to photography too!

Alcohol a diuretic. A diuretic is any substance that promotes diuresis, that is, the increased production of urine. You drink alcohol (diuretic) because you are thirsty, it makes you pee more. So you drink more alcohol (diuretic) because you are thirsty from peeing. Now you are thirsty because you are peeing more so you drink another one, now your judgment is blued and you keep drinking to quench your thirst and pee more. (vicious cycle) Eventually, your body is running out of fluids, so you get dry mouth and drink more. A hangover occurs (head hurts) because you have no fluids in your body (dehydrated). Dizzy? No fluids = dehydrated. Not to mention the effects of alcohol on a body without liquids.
I was figuring it was nothing I would ever need.

WRITING.TITLE: Why is there a US versions, UK versions etc....of a Album/CD
WRITING.TEXT:
Why is there a US version, UK version and Japan version etc.. of an album. Why are they different?
*edit - spelling

The job of pee is to eliminate waste. It is colored and stinks from the waste your body produces. Your pee is clear because you are pumping out liquid which has not had time to absorb waste products. Alcohol a diuretic. A diuretic is any substance that promotes diuresis, that is, the increased production of urine. You drink alcohol (diuretic) because you are thirsty, it makes you pee more. So you drink more alcohol (diuretic) because you are thirsty from peeing. Now you are thirsty because you are peeing more so you drink another one, now your judgment is blued and you keep drinking to quench your thirst and pee more. (vicious cycle) Eventually your body is running out of fluids, so you get dry mouth and drink more. A hang over occurs (head hurts) because you have no fluids in your body (dehydrated). Dizzy? No fluids = dehydrated. Not to mention the effects of alcohol on a body without liquids.
On a side note, when you take all those vitamins and protein drinks and your pee is dark and stinks, those are your vitamins and protein that you paid so much for going down the drain. You put more in your body then it can process at one time so you pee it out. Flushing money down the drain
Buy anything to protect your lens! Rather damage a polarizing filter then the entire lens. It's like lens insurance.
